result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen J. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Operate w/o Valid License(3rd+ w/in3Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Allen J. Johnson not in court, defendant in custody. 

1:06 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

This a Blessinger Hearing for a Committment Warrant that was issued for failure to pay fines, fees, or costs that were previously ordered by the Court.  
Court Case(s) #:  16CF54

Court questions the Defendant as to his/her reasons for failing to pay and his/her financial status.
Defendant makes statement as to why he has failed to pay his fines.
Defendant can put up $500 at the present time.
Court informs the Defendant that serving time in jail will not reduce or eliminate the fine.

BY THE COURT:  
Defendant to be released upon the payment of $500 and upon release he is to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office within 72 hours.

original filed in 15CF401

Defendant Allen J. Johnson in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases to have been heard today are 15CF401, 16CF54, 15CT302 and 15CT334.

10:46 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Defendant makes statements.
Atty Cousins makes statements.

Atty Redfield is now hear and it is approx. 10:50 a.m.
10:56 a.m.   Court re-calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF401:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - No contest

16CF54:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - No contest

15CT302:
Count 1- DRI

15CT334:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 & 3 of 15CF401 and Count 1 & 5 on 16CF54 and Count 1 of 15CF401 is DRI, Count 2-4 of 16CF54 are DRI, Count 1 of 15CT302 is DRI and Count 1 of 15CT334 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF401:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 18 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Complete 50 hours of community service
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Maintain full-time employment.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Jeremy Haas and Kyle Orlowski
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate and recommended by the agent.

Count 3 -
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 18 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 2 of 15CF401
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

16CF54:
Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 18 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 2 of 15CF401
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

10 day jail sentence - all can be completed on GPS electronic home monitor
60 days to commence
Report to jail today for start date

ADA Cousins states the status of the case and was contacted by Atty Redfield. Defendant doesn't want to accept plea agreement on 15CF401.

15CF401 is scheduled for trial and the rest of the cases will track with as status. 
  Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

8:40 a.m. Defendant Allen J. Johnson in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received & reviewed the Competency Report. Parties stipulate to the report findings of competent to proceed. Court questions the Defendant. Atty Redfield states the Defendant agrees with the report. BY THE COURT: Defendant is found competent to proceed. Preliminary waiver was done earlier and ready to proceed with the Arraignment today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cases 15CF401 and 16CF54.

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered on 15CF401 and 16CF54.

Bond Continued.

Competency hearing on June 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

9:25 a.m. Attorney Jared Redfield in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State informs the Court the exam is not completed as the examiner needs updated phone number and address information. Atty Redfield states he will get that information updated. BTC: Court reschedules cases 16CF54, 15CT334, 15CF401, and 15CT302.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Status conference at 04-25-2016 10:30 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Atty Cousins indictes that a Competency Exam has already been completed and Atty Redfield will not be requesting another one.

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Allen J. Johnson in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:31 p.m  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Atty Redfield does not have a signed Waiver at the time of the hearing.
Atty Redfield states to the Court that his client does not fully understand the charges against him and is requesting a competency hearing after the information is filed. 
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

BY THE COURT:
Bound over to Branch 2. 
  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 02-22-2016 03:00 pm

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License
